get.description:
This request retrieves all floating IPs in the region. Floating IPs allow inbound and
outbound traffic from the Internet to an instance.

200.description: The floating IPs were retrieved successfully.

post.description: This request reserves a new floating IP.

201.description: The floating IP was reserved successfully.

400.description: An invalid floating IP prototype object was provided.

409.description: The specified target is in use by another floating IP.

delete.description:
This request disassociates (if associated) and releases a floating IP. This operation cannot
be reversed. For this request to succeed, the floating IP must not be required by another
resource, such as a public gateway.

204.description: The floating IP was released successfully.

404.description: The specified floating IP could not be found.

409.description: The floating IP is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single floating IP specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The floating IP was retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified floating IP could not be found.

patch.description: This request updates a floating IP's name and/or target.

200.description: The floating IP was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid floating IP patch was provided.

404.description: A floating IP with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The specified target is in use by another floating IP.

get.description:
This request retrieves all flow log collectors in the region. A flow log collector
summarizes data sent over one or more network interfaces within a VPC, depending on the
chosen target.

parameters.description: Filters the collection to flow log collectors that target the specified resource.
parameters.name: target.id

parameters.description: Filters the collection to flow log collectors that target the specified resource type.
parameters.name: target.resource_type

200.description: The flow log collectors were retrieved successfully.

post.description:
This request creates and starts a new flow log collector from a flow log collector prototype
object. The prototype object is structured in the same way as a retrieved flow log
collector, and contains the information necessary to create and start the new flow log
collector.

requestBody.description: The flow log collector prototype object

201.description: The flow log collector was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid flow log collector prototype object was provided.

409.description: The specified target is in use by another flow log collector.

delete.description:
This request stops and deletes a flow log collector. Collected flow logs remain
available within the flow log collector's bucket.

204.description: The flow log collector was deleted successfully.

404.description: The specified flow log collector could not be found.

delete.summary: Delete the specified flow log collector

get.description: This request retrieves a single flow log collector specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The flow log collector was retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified flow log collector could not be found.

get.summary: Retrieve the specified flow log collector

patch.description:
This request updates a flow log collector with the information in a provided flow log
collector patch. The flow log collector patch object is structured in the same way as a
retrieved flow log collector and contains only the information to be updated.

200.description: The flow log collector was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid flow log collector patch was provided.

404.description: A flow log collector with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.summary: Update the specified flow log collector

get.description:
This request lists all images available in the region. An image provides source data for a
volume. Images are either system-provided, or created from another source, such as importing
from object storage.

parameters.description: Filters the collection to images with the specified visibility
parameters.name: visibility

operating_system.display_name: Ubuntu Linux 16.04 LTS Xenial Xerus Minimal Install (amd64)
operating_system.name: ubuntu-16-04-amd64

200.description: Images retrieved successfully

post.description:
This request creates a new image from an image prototype object. The prototype object is
structured in the same way as a retrieved image, and contains the information necessary to
create the new image. A URL to the image file on object storage must be provided.

201.description: Image created successfully

400.description: An invalid image prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes an image. This operation cannot be reversed. System-provided images are
not allowed to be deleted. An image with a `status` of `pending`, `tentative`, or `deleting`
cannot be deleted.

202.description: The image deletion request was accepted.

403.description: The image is not allowed to be deleted.

404.description: An image with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The image cannot be deleted in its current state.

get.description: This request retrieves a single image specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: Image retrieved successfully

404.description: An image with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description:
This request updates an image with the information in a provided image patch. The image
patch object is structured in the same way as a retrieved image and contains only the
information to be updated. System-provided images are not allowed to be updated.
An image with a `status` of `deleting` cannot be updated.

200.description: Image updated successfully

400.description: An invalid image patch was provided.

403.description: The image is not allowed to be updated.

404.description: An image with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The image cannot be updated in its current state.

200.description: The instances were retrieved successfully.

post.description:
This request provisions a new instance from an instance prototype object. The prototype
object is structured in the same way as a retrieved instance, and contains the information
necessary to provision the new instance. The instance is automatically started.

400.description: An invalid instance prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes an instance. This operation cannot be reversed. Any floating IPs
associated with the instance's network interfaces are implicitly disassociated.

204.description: The instance was deleted successfully.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

This request updates an instance with the information in a provided instance patch. The
instance patch object is structured in the same way as a retrieved instance and contains
only the information to be updated.

400.description: An invalid instance patch was provided.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

keys and the Windows administrator password.

post.description:
This request creates a new action which will be queued up to run as soon as any pending or
running actions have completed.

201.description: The action was created successfully and will run in the order it was received.

400.description: The specified action could not be created.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all network interfaces on an instance. A network interface is an abstract
representation of a network interface card and connects an instance to a subnet. While each
network interface can attach to only one subnet, multiple network interfaces can be created
to attach to multiple subnets. Multiple interfaces may also attach to the same subnet.

200.description: The network interfaces were retrieved successfully.

errors.message: Please check whether the resource you are requesting exists.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all network interfaces on an instance

post.description:
This request creates a new network interface from a network interface prototype object. The
prototype object is structured in the same way as a retrieved network interface, and
contains the information necessary to create the new network interface. Any subnet in the
instance's VPC may be specified, even if it is already attached to another network
interface. Addresses on the network interface must be within the specified subnet's CIDR
blocks.

201.description: The network interface was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid network interface prototype object was provided.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

delete.description:
This request deletes a network interface. This operation cannot be reversed. Any floating
IPs associated with the network interface are implicitly disassociated.  The primary network
interface is not allowed to be deleted.

204.description: Network interface deleted successfully

403.description: The network interface is not allowed to be deleted.

404.description: A network interface with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description: This request retrieves a single network interface specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The network interface was retrieved successfully.

errors.message: Please check whether the resource you are requesting exists.

404.description: A network interface with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description:
This request updates a network interface with the information in a provided network
interface patch. The network interface patch object is structured in the same way as a
retrieved network interface and can contain an updated name and/or port speed.

200.description: The network interface was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid network interface patch was provided.

404.description: A network interface with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description: This request lists all floating IPs associated with a network interface.

200.description: The associated floating IPs were retrieved successfully.

errors.message: Please check whether the resource you are requesting exists.

404.description: A network interface with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all floating IPs associated with a network interface

delete.description: This request disassociates the specified floating IP from the specified network interface

204.description: The floating IP was disassociated successfully.

400.description: The specified floating IP could not be disassociated.

404.description:
The specified floating IP address is not associated with the network interface with the
specified identifier

get.description:
This request a retrieves a specified floating IP address if it is associated with the
network interface and instance specified in the URL

200.description: The associated floating IP was retrieved successfully.

404.description:
The floating IP address is not associated with a network interface with the specified
identifier

put.description:
This request associates the specified floating IP with the specified network interface,
replacing any existing association. For this request to succeed, the existing floating IP
must not be required by another resource, such as a public gateway. A request body is not
required, and if supplied, is ignored.

201.description: The floating IP was successfully associated with the network interface.

400.description: The specified floating IP could not be associated with the specified network interface.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

put.summary: Associate a floating IP with a network interface

get.description:
This request lists all volume attachments for an instance. A volume attachment connects a
volume to an instance. Each instance may have many volume attachments but each volume
attachment connects exactly one instance to exactly one volume.

200.description: The volume attachments were retrieved successfully.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all volumes attached to an instance

post.description:
This request creates a new volume attachment from a volume attachment prototype object. The
prototype object is structured in the same way as a retrieved volume attachment, and
contains the information necessary to create the new volume attachment. The creation of a
new volume attachment connects a volume to an instance.

201.description:
The volume attachment was created successfully, attaching the specified volume to the
instance.

400.description: An invalid volume attachment prototype object was provided.

404.description: An instance with the specified identifier could not be found.

post.summary: Create a volume attachment, connecting a volume to an instance

delete.description:
This request deletes a volume attachment. The deletion of a volume attachment detaches a
volume from an instance.

204.description: The volume attachment was deleted successfully, detaching its volume from the instance

404.description:
A volume attachment with the specified identifier could not be found for the specified
instance.

delete.summary: Delete a volume attachment, detaching a volume from an instance

get.description: This request retrieves a single volume attachment specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The volume attachment was retrieved successfully.

404.description:
A volume attachment with the specified identifier could not be found for the specified
instance.

patch.description:
This request updates a volume attachment with the information in a provided volume
attachment patch. The volume attachment patch object is structured in the same way as a
retrieved volume attachment and can contain an updated name.

200.description: The volume attachment was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid volume attachment patch was provided.

404.description:
A volume attachment with the specified identifier could not be found for the specified
instance.

get.description:
This request lists all network ACLs in the region. A network ACL defines a set of packet
filtering (5-tuple) rules for all traffic in and out of a subnet. Both allow and deny rules
can be defined, and rules are stateless such that reverse traffic in response to allowed
traffic is not automatically permitted.

200.description: Network ACLs retrieved successfully

post.description:
This request creates a new network ACL from a network ACL prototype object. The prototype
object is structured in the same way as a retrieved network ACL, and contains the
information necessary to create the new network ACL.

201.description: Network ACL created successfully

400.description: An invalid network ACL prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes a network ACL. This operation cannot be reversed. For this request to
succeed, the network ACL must not be the default network ACL for any VPCs, and the network
ACL must not be attached to any subnets.

204.description: Network ACL deleted successfully

403.description: A default network ACL is not allowed to be deleted.

404.description: A network ACL with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The network ACL is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single network ACL specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: Network ACL retrieved successfully

404.description: A network ACL with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description: This request updates a network ACL's name.

200.description: The network ACL was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid network ACL patch was provided.

404.description: A network ACL with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all rules for a network ACL. These rules can allow or deny traffic
between a source CIDR block and a destination CIDR block over a particular protocol and port
range.

parameters.description: Filters the collection to rules with the specified direction
parameters.name: direction

200.description: The rules were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A network ACL with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all rules for a network ACL

post.description:
This request creates a new rule from a network ACL rule prototype object. The prototype
object is structured in the same way as a retrieved rule, and contains the information
necessary to create the new rule.

requestBody.description: The network ACL rule prototype object

201.description: The rule was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid network ACL prototype object was provided.

404.description: A network ACL with the specified identifier could not be found.

delete.description: This request deletes a rule. This operation cannot be reversed.

204.description: The rule was deleted successfully.

404.description: A rule with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description: This request retrieves a single rule specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The rule was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A rule with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all public gateways. A public gateway is a virtual network device
associated with a VPC, which allows access to the Internet. A public gateway resides in a
zone and can be connected to subnets in the same zone only.

200.description: The public gateways were retrieved successfully.

post.description:
This request creates a new public gateway from a public gateway prototype object. If a
floating IP is provided, it must be unbound. If a floating IP is not provided, one will be
created and bound to the public gateway. Once a public gateway has been created, its floating
IP cannot be unbound. A public gateway must be explicitly attached to each subnet it will
provide connectivity for.

201.description: The public gateway was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid public gateway prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes a public gateway. This operation cannot be reversed. For this request
to succeed, the public gateway must not be attached to any subnets. The public gateway's
floating IP will be automatically unbound. If the floating IP was created when the public
gateway was created, it will be deleted.

204.description: The public gateway was deleted successfully.

404.description: A public gateway with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The public gateway is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single public gateway specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The public gateway was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A public gateway with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description: This request updates a public gateway's name.

200.description: The public gateway was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid public gateway patch was provided.

404.description: A public gateway with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all regions. Each region is a separate geographic area that contains
multiple isolated zones. Resources can be provisioned into a one or more zones in a region.
Each zone is isolated, but connected to other zones in the same region with low-latency and
high-bandwidth links. Regions represent the top-level of fault isolation available.
Resources deployed within a single region also benefit from the low latency afforded by
geographic proximity.

200.description: The regions were retrieved successfully.

get.description: This request retrieves a single region specified by the name in the URL.

200.description: The region was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A region with the specified name could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all zones in a region. Zones represent logically-isolated data centers
with high-bandwidth and low-latency interconnects to other zones in the same region. Faults
in a zone do not affect other zones.

200.description: The zones were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A region with the specified name could not be found.

get.summary: List all zones in a region

get.description: This request retrieves a single zone specified by the region and zone names in the URL.

200.description: The zone was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A zone with the specified name could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all existing security groups. Security groups provide a convenient way to
apply IP filtering rules to instances in the associated VPC. With security groups, all
traffic is denied by default, and rules added to security groups define which traffic the
security group permits. Security group rules are stateful such that reverse traffic in
response to allowed traffic is automatically permitted.

200.description: The security groups were retrieved successfully.

post.description:
This request creates a new security group from a security group prototype object. The
prototype object is structured in the same way as a retrieved security group, and contains
the information necessary to create the new security group. If security group rules are
included in the protoype object, those rules will be added to the security group. Each
security group is scoped to one VPC. Only network interfaces on instances in that VPC can be
added to the security group.

201.description: The security group was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid security group prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes a security group. A security group cannot be deleted if it is
referenced by any network interfaces or other security group rules. Additionally, a VPC's
default security group cannot be deleted. This operation cannot be reversed.

204.description: The security group was deleted successfully.

403.description: The VPC's default security group is not allowed to be deleted.

404.description: A security group with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The security group is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single security group specified by the identifier in the URL path.

200.description: The security group was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A security group with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description:
This request updates a security group with the information provided in a security group
patch object. The security group patch object is structured in the same way as a retrieved
security group and contains only the information to be updated.

200.description: The security group was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid security group patch was provided.

404.description: A security group with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all network interfaces associated with the security group, to which the
rules in the security group are applied.

200.description: The network interfaces were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A security group with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List a security group's network interfaces

delete.description:
This request removes a network interface from a security group. Security groups are
stateful, so any changes to a network interface's security groups are applied to new
connections. Existing connections are not affected. If the network interface being removed
has no other security groups, it will be attached to the VPC's default security group.

204.description: The network interface was successfully removed from the security group.

404.description: The specified network interface was not in the specified security group.

delete.summary: Remove a network interface from a security group.

get.description:
This request retrieves a single network interface specified by the identifier in the URL
path. The network interface must be an existing member of the security group.

200.description: The requested network interface

404.description: The specified security group does not contain the specified network interface.

get.summary: Retrieve a network interface in a security group

put.description:
This request adds an existing network interface to an existing security group. When a
network interface is added to a security group, the security group rules are applied to the
network interface. A request body is not required, and if supplied, is ignored.

201.description: The network interface was successfully added to the security group

400.description: The specified network interface could not be added to the specified security group.

404.description: The specified network interface or security group could not be found.

put.summary: Add a network interface to a security group

get.description:
This request lists all the security group rules for a particular security group. These rules
define what traffic the security group permits. Security group rules are stateful, such that
reverse traffic in response to allowed traffic is automatically permitted.

200.description: The security group rules were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A security group with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all the rules of a security group

post.description:
This request creates a new security group rule from a security group rule prototype object.
The prototype object is structured in the same way as a retrieved security group rule and
contains the information necessary to create the rule. As part of creating a new rule in a
security group, the rule is applied to all the networking interfaces in the security group.
Rules specify which IP traffic a security group should allow. Security group rules are
stateful, such that reverse traffic in response to allowed traffic is automatically
permitted. A rule allowing inbound TCP traffic on port 80 also allows outbound TCP traffic
on port 80 without the need for an additional rule.

requestBody.description: The properties of the security group rule to be created.

201.description: The security group rule was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid security group rule prototype object was provided.

404.description: A security group with the specified identifier could not be found.

delete.description:
This request deletes a security group rule. This operation cannot be reversed. Removing a
security group rule will not end existing connections allowed by that rule.

204.description: The rule was deleted successfully.

404.description: A rule with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request retrieves a single security group rule specified by the identifier in the URL
path.

200.description: The rule was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A rule with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description:
This request updates a security group rule with the information in a provided rule patch
object. The rule patch object contains only the information to be updated. The request will
fail if the information is not applicable to the rule's protocol.

200.description: The security group rule was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid security group rule patch was provided.

404.description: A rule with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all subnets in the region. Subnets are contiguous ranges of IP addresses
specified in CIDR block notation. Each subnet is within a particular zone and cannot span
multiple zones or regions.

200.description: The subnets were retrieved successfully.

post.description:
This request creates a new subnet from a subnet prototype object. The prototype object is
structured in the same way as a retrieved subnet, and contains the information necessary to
create the new subnet. For this request to succeed, the prototype's CIDR block must not
overlap with an existing subnet in the VPC.

201.description: The subnet was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid subnet prototype object was provided.

409.description: The subnet prototype object conflicts with another subnet in the VPC.

delete.description:
This request deletes a subnet. This operation cannot be reversed. For this request to
succeed, the subnet must not be referenced by any network interfaces, VPN gateways, or load
balancers. A delete operation automatically detaches the subnet from any network ACLs and
public gateways.

204.description: The subnet was deleted successfully.

404.description: A subnet with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The subnet is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single subnet specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The subnet was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A subnet with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description:
This request updates a subnet with the information in a provided subnet patch. The subnet
patch object is structured in the same way as a retrieved subnet and contains only the
information to be updated.

200.description: The subnet was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid subnet patch was provided.

404.description: A subnet with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request retrieves the network ACL attached to the subnet specified by the identifier in
the URL.

200.description: The attached network ACL was retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified subnet could not be found.

get.summary: Retrieve a subnet's attached network ACL

put.description:
This request attaches the network ACL, specified in the request body, to the subnet
specified by the subnet identifier in the URL. This replaces the existing network ACL on the
subnet.

201.description: The network ACL was attached successfully.

400.description: The specified network ACL could not be attached to the specified subnet.

404.description: A subnet with the specified identifier could not be found.

put.summary: Attach a network ACL to a subnet

delete.description:
This request detaches the public gateway from the subnet specified by the subnet identifier
in the URL.

204.description: The public gateway was detached successfully.

404.description: The specified subnet could not be found.

delete.summary: Detach a public gateway from a subnet

get.description:
This request retrieves the public gateway attached to the subnet specified by the identifier
in the URL.

200.description: The attached public gateway was retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified subnet could not be found.

get.summary: Retrieve a subnet's attached public gateway

put.description:
This request attaches the public gateway, specified in the request body, to the subnet
specified by the subnet identifier in the URL. The public gateway must have the same VPC and
zone as the subnet.

201.description: The public gateway was attached successfully.

400.description: The specified public gateway could not be attached to the specified subnet.

404.description: A subnet with the specified identifier could not be found.

put.summary: Attach a public gateway to a subnet

get.description:
This request lists all volume profiles available in the region. A volume profile specifies
the performance characteristics and pricing model for a volume.

200.description: Volume profiles retrieved successfully

get.description: This request retrieves a single volume profile specified by the name in the URL.

200.description: Volume profile retrieved successfully

404.description: A volume profile with the specified name could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all volumes in the region. Volumes are network-connected block storage
devices that may be attached to one or more instances in the same region.

200.description: Volumes retrieved successfully

post.description:
This request creates a new volume from a volume prototype object. The prototype object is
structured in the same way as a retrieved volume, and contains the information necessary to
create the new volume.

201.description: Volume created successfully

400.description: An invalid volume prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes a volume. This operation cannot be reversed. For this request to
succeed, the volume must not be attached to any instances.

204.description: Volume deleted successfully

404.description: A volume with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The volume is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single volume specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: Volume retrieved successfully

404.description: A volume with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description:
This request updates a volume with the information in a provided volume patch. The volume
patch object is structured in the same way as a retrieved volume and contains only the
information to be updated.

200.description: Volume updated successfully

400.description: An invalid volume patch was provided.

404.description: A volume with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request lists all VPCs. A VPC is a virtual network that belongs to an account and
provides logical isolation from other networks. A VPC is made up of resources in one or more
zones. VPCs are regional, and each VPC can contain resources in multiple zones in a region.

parameters.description:
The `classic_access` parameter filters the returned collection by the supplied field. If
the supplied field is `true`, only Classic Access VPCs will be returned. If the supplied
field is `false`, only VPCs without Classic Access will be returned.
parameters.name: classic_access

200.description: The VPCs were retrieved successfully.

post.description:
This request creates a new VPC from a VPC prototype object. The prototype object is
structured in the same way as a retrieved VPC, and contains the information necessary to
create the new VPC.

201.description: The VPC was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid VPC prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes a VPC. This operation cannot be reversed. For this request to
succeed, the VPC must not contain any instances, subnets, or public gateways. All
security groups and network ACLs associated with the VPC are automatically deleted.

204.description: The VPC was deleted successfully.

400.description: The VPC could not be deleted.

404.description: A VPC with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The VPC is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single VPC specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The VPC was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A VPC with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description: This request updates a VPC's name.

200.description: The VPC was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid VPC patch was provided.

404.description: A VPC with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description:
This request retrieves the default network ACL for the VPC specified by the identifier in
the URL. The default network ACL is applied to any new subnets in the VPC which do not
specify a network ACL.

200.description: The default network ACL was retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified VPC could not be found.

get.summary: Retrieve a VPC's default network ACL

get.description:
This request retrieves the default security group for the VPC specified by the identifier in
the URL. The default security group is applied to any new network interfaces in the VPC that
do not specify a security group.

200.description: The default security group was retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified VPC could not be found.

get.summary: Retrieve a VPC's default security group

get.description: This request lists all address pool prefixes for a VPC.

200.description: The prefixes were retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified VPC could not be found.

get.summary: List all address pool prefixes for a VPC

post.description:
This request creates a new prefix from a prefix prototype object. The prototype object is
structured in the same way as a retrieved prefix, and contains the information necessary to
create the new prefix.

201.description: The prefix was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid prefix prototype object was provided.

404.description: The specified VPC could not be found.

409.description: The prefix protoype object conflicts with another prefix in the VPC.

delete.description:
This request deletes a prefix. This operation cannot be reversed. The request will fail if
any subnets use addresses from this prefix.

204.description: The prefix was deleted successfully.

404.description: A prefix with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The prefix is in use and cannot be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single prefix specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The prefix was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A prefix with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description:
This request updates a prefix with the information in a provided prefix patch. The prefix
patch object is structured in the same way as a retrieved prefix and contains only the
information to be updated.

200.description: The prefix was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid prefix patch was provided.

404.description: A prefix with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The prefix patch conflicts with another prefix in the VPC.

get.description:
This request retrieves routes in the VPC's default routing table. For compatibility,
routes with `action` values other than `deliver` are omitted. Each route is
zone-specific and directs any packets matching its destination CIDR block to a `next_hop`
IP address. The most specific route matching a packet's destination will be used. If
multiple equally-specific routes exist, traffic will be distributed across them.

200.description: The routes were retrieved successfully.

404.description: The specified VPC could not be found.

get.summary: List all routes in the VPC's default routing table.

post.description:
This request creates a new route in the VPC's default routing table. The route prototype
object is structured in the same way as a retrieved route, and contains the information
necessary to create the new route. The request will fail if the new route will cause a loop.

201.description: The route was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid route prototype object was provided.

404.description: The specified VPC could not be found.

409.description: The route prototype object conflicts with another route in the VPC.

post.summary: Create a route in the VPC's default routing table

delete.description: This request deletes a route. This operation cannot be reversed.

204.description: The route was deleted successfully.

404.description: A route with the specified identifier could not be found.

delete.summary: Delete the specified route in the VPC's default routing table

get.description: This request retrieves a single route specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The route was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A route with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: Retrieve the specified route in the VPC's default routing table

patch.description:
This request updates a route with the information in a provided route patch. The route patch
object is structured in the same way as a retrieved route and contains only the information
to be updated.

200.description: The route was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid route patch was provided.

404.description: A route with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The route cannot be updated while it is being deleted.

patch.summary: Update the specified route in the VPC's default routing table

get.description: This request retrieves a paginated list of all VPN gateways that belong to this account.

200.description: The VPN gateways were retrieved successfully.

post.description: This request creates a new VPN gateway.

201.description: The VPN gateway was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid VPN gateway prototype object was provided.

delete.description:
This request deletes a VPN gateway. A VPN gateway with a `status` of `pending`
cannot be deleted. This operation deletes all VPN connections associated
with this VPN gateway.  This operation cannot be reversed.

202.description: The VPN gateway deletion request has been accepted.

404.description: A VPN gateway with the specified identifier could not be found.

409.description: The VPN gateway is not allowed to be deleted.

get.description: This request retrieves a single VPN gateway specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The VPN gateway was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A VPN gateway with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description: This request updates the properties of an existing VPN gateway.

200.description: The VPN gateway was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid VPN gateway patch was provided.

404.description: A VPN gateway with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description: This request lists all the connections of a particular VPN gateway.

parameters.description: Filters the collection to VPN connections with the specified status
parameters.name: status

200.description: The VPN connections were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A VPN gateway with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all the connections of a VPN gateway

post.description: This request creates a new VPN connection.

201.description: The VPN connection was created successfully.

400.description: An invalid VPN connection prototype object was provided.

delete.description: This request deletes a VPN connection. This operation cannot be reversed.

202.description: The VPN connection deletion request has been accepted.

404.description: A VPN connection with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description: This request retrieves a single VPN connection specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The VPN connection was retrieved successfully.

404.description: A VPN connection with the specified identifier could not be found.

patch.description: This request updates the properties of an existing VPN connection.

200.description: The VPN connection was updated successfully.

400.description: An invalid VPN connection patch was provided.

404.description: A VPN connection with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.description: This request lists all local CIDRs for the resource specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The CIDRs were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A resource with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all local CIDRs for a resource

delete.description: This request removes a CIDR from a resource.

204.description: The CIDR was successfully removed from the resource.

404.description:
The specified CIDR does not exist on the specified resource or the specified resource
could not be found.

delete.summary: Remove a CIDR from a resource

get.description: This request succeeds if a CIDR exists on the resource and fails otherwise.

204.description: The specified CIDR exists on the specified resource.

404.description:
The specified CIDR does not exist on the specified resource or the specified resource
could not be found.

get.summary: Check if a specific CIDR exists on a specific resource

put.description:
This request adds the specified CIDR to the specified resource. A request body is not
required, and if supplied, is ignored. This request succeeds if the CIDR already exists on
the resource.

204.description: The CIDR was successfully set on the resource.

400.description: The supplied CIDR was invalid.

404.description: The specified resource could not be found.

put.summary: Set a CIDR on a resource

get.description: This request lists all peer CIDRs for the resource specified by the identifier in the URL.

200.description: The CIDRs were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A resource with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: List all peer CIDRs for a resource

delete.description: This request removes a CIDR from a resource.

204.description: The CIDR was successfully removed from the resource.

404.description:
The specified CIDR does not exist on the specified resource or the specified resource
could not be found.

delete.summary: Remove a CIDR from a resource

get.description: This request succeeds if a CIDR exists on the resource and fails otherwise.

204.description: The specified CIDR exists on the specified resource.

404.description:
The specified CIDR does not exist on the specified resource or the specified resource
could not be found.

get.summary: Check if a specific CIDR exists on a specific resource

put.description:
This request adds the specified CIDR to the specified resource. A request body is not
required, and if supplied, is ignored. This request succeeds if the CIDR already exists on
the resource.

204.description: The CIDR was successfully set on the resource.

400.description: The supplied CIDR was invalid.

404.description: The specified resource could not be found.

put.summary: Set a CIDR on a resource

id.description: The unique identifier for this address prefix

is_default.description:
Indicates whether this is the default prefix for this zone in this VPC. If a
default prefix was automatically created when the VPC was created, the prefix is
automatically named using a hyphenated list of randomly-selected words, but may be
updated with a user-specified name.

name.description:
The user-defined name for this address prefix. Names must be unique within the VPC the
address prefix resides in.

allOf.description: The zone this address prefix resides in

is_default.description:
Indicates whether this is the default prefix for this zone in this VPC.
Updating to true makes this prefix the default prefix for this zone in this VPC,
provided the VPC currently has no default address prefix for this zone.
Updating to false removes the default prefix for this zone in this VPC.

name.description:
The user-defined name for this address prefix. Names must be unique within the VPC the
address prefix resides in.

cidr.description:
The CIDR block for this address prefix. The request must not overlap with any
existing address prefixes in the VPC, and must fall within the
[RFC 1918](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1918) address ranges.

is_default.description:
Indicates whether this is the default prefix for this zone in this VPC.
If true, this prefix will become the default prefix for this zone in this VPC.
This fails if the VPC currently has a default address prefix for this zone.

name.description:
The user-defined name for this address prefix. Names must be unique within the VPC the
address prefix resides in. If unspecified, the name will be a hyphenated list of
randomly-selected words.

allOf.description: The zone this address prefix is to belong to

cidr_block.description:
The CIDR block. This property may add support for IPv6 CIDR blocks in the future. When
processing a value in this property, verify that the CIDR block is in an expected
format. If it is not, log an error. Optionally halt processing and surface the error, or
bypass the resource on which the unexpected CIDR block format was encountered.

allOf.description: The resource group for this security group

rules.description:
Array of rules for the default security group for a VPC. Defaults to allowing all

When `protocol` is `all`, then it's invalid to specify `port_min`, `port_max`, `type` or
`code`.
SecurityGroupRuleProtocolAll.title: SecurityGroupRuleProtocolAll

SecurityGroupRuleProtocolICMP.description:
When `protocol` is `icmp`, then the rule may also contain fields to specify an ICMP `type`
and `code`. Field `code` may only be specified if `type` is also specified. If type is not
specified, then traffic is allowed for all types and codes. If type is specified and code is
not specified, then traffic is allowed with the specified type for all codes.

SecurityGroupRuleProtocolICMP.title: SecurityGroupRuleProtocolICMP

SecurityGroupRuleProtocolTCPUDP.description:
If `protocol` is either `tcp` or `udp`, then the rule may also contain `port_min` and
`port_max`. Either both should be set, or neither. When neither is set then traffic is
allowed on all ports. For a single port, set both to the same value.

port_min.description: The inclusive lower bound of TCP/UDP port range

match this field, if they are used. Alternatively, if `remote` references a security

matching this IP version.

security group. If omitted, a CIDR block of `0.0.0.0/0` will be used to allow traffic
from any source (or to any source, for outbound rules).

zone of the address prefix that contains the IPv4 CIDR. If zone is specified, it
must match the zone of the address prefix that contains the subnet's IPv4 CIDR.

get.description: This request lists all the connections that use the specified policy.

200.description: The VPN connections were retrieved successfully.

404.description: A policy with the specified identifier could not be found.

get.summary: Lists all the connections that use the specified policy

delete.description: This request removes a CIDR from a resource.

204.description: The CIDR was successfully removed from the resource.

404.description:
The specified CIDR does not exist on the specified resource or the specified resource
could not be found.

delete.summary: Remove a CIDR from a resource

get.description: This request succeeds if a CIDR exists on the resource and fails otherwise.

204.description: The specified CIDR exists on the specified resource.

404.description:
The specified CIDR does not exist on the specified resource or the specified resource
could not be found.

get.summary: Check if a specific CIDR exists on a specific resource

put.description:
This request adds the specified CIDR to the specified resource. A request body is not
required, and if supplied, is ignored. This request succeeds if the CIDR already exists on
the resource.

204.description: The CIDR was successfully set on the resource.

400.description: The supplied CIDR was invalid.

404.description: The specified resource could not be found.

put.summary: Set a CIDR on a resource
